summary: Email correspondence between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding document management for the Epstein investigation. The AUSAs are seeking examples of past cases where their office used a vendor for scanning, cataloguing, and indexing documents, and propose a call to discuss.

persons.name: SSA Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: Recipient of an email from AUSAs regarding document management for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sender of an email to the FBI, identifying themselves as one of the AUSAs working on the Epstein investigation and seeking to discuss document management procedures.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

connections.description: The AUSA is contacting the FBI agent to coordinate on document management logistics for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein investigation documents
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys email an FBI agent to discuss obtaining examples of past cases where their office used a vendor for scanning, cataloguing, and indexing documents, specifically for the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
SSA Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York

keyFacts: The document is an email from May 17, 2019, showing coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and the FBI on the Epstein investigation.
The AUSAs are seeking examples of past cases where their office used a vendor for document scanning, cataloguing, and indexing, indicating a large volume of evidence.
The email references 'some concern' about having their office manage documents with a vendor, suggesting logistical or procedural discussions within the investigation.
The FBI unit involved is Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking, indicating the investigation's focus on human trafficking aspects.
